  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;

                </span>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)

      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>IOCTL$I915_PXP_OPS will call i915_pxp_ops_ioctl to handle pxp ioctls. if *pxp_ops->action* is DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_ACTION_SET_SESSION_STATUS, it will call *pxp_set_session_status*. *params* is copied from userspace[1], which means *params* is under user control, including *params.pxp_tag*. If *params.req_session_state* is *DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY*, it will call *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*[2] with *params.pxp_tag*. There is no check about the *session_id*(*params.pxp_tag*) in *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*, and will cause out of bounds read/write.<span class="line"><!---->IOCTL$I915_PXP_OPS will call i915_pxp_ops_ioctl to handle pxp ioctls. if *pxp_ops-&gt;action* is DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_ACTION_SET_SESSION_STATUS, it will call *pxp_set_session_status*. *params* is copied from userspace[1], which means *params* is under user control, including *params.pxp_tag*. If *params.req_session_state* is *DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY*, it will call *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*[2] with *params.pxp_tag*. There is no check about the *session_id*(*params.pxp_tag*) in *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*, and will cause out of bounds read/write.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static int pxp_set_session_status(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->static int pxp_set_session_status(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>				  struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_ops *pxp_ops,<span class="line"><!---->				  struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_ops *pxp_ops,<!----></span><br>				  struct drm_file *drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->				  struct drm_file *drmfile)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params params;<span class="line"><!---->	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params params;<!----></span><br>	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params __user *uparams =<span class="line"><!---->	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params __user *uparams =<!----></span><br>		u64_to_user_ptr(pxp_ops->params);<span class="line"><!---->		u64_to_user_ptr(pxp_ops-&gt;params);<!----></span><br>	int ret = 0;<span class="line"><!---->	int ret = 0;<!----></span><br><br>	if (copy_from_user(&params, uparams, sizeof(params)) != 0)		// [1]<span class="line"><!---->	if (copy_from_user(&amp;params, uparams, sizeof(params)) != 0)		// [1]<!----></span><br>		return -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EFAULT;<!----></span><br><br>	switch (params.req_session_state) {<span class="line"><!---->	switch (params.req_session_state) {<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_ID_INIT:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_ID_INIT:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_reserve_session(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_reserve_session(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							 params.session_mode,<span class="line"><!---->							 params.session_mode,<!----></span><br>							 &params.pxp_tag);<span class="line"><!---->							 &amp;params.pxp_tag);<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							      params.pxp_tag);					// [2]<span class="line"><!---->							      params.pxp_tag);					// [2]<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_TERMINATE:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_TERMINATE:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_terminate_session(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_terminate_session(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							   params.pxp_tag);<span class="line"><!---->							   params.pxp_tag);<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	default:<span class="line"><!---->	default:<!----></span><br>		ret = -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		ret = -EINVAL;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	if (ret >= 0) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (ret &gt;= 0) {<!----></span><br>		pxp_ops->status = ret;<span class="line"><!---->		pxp_ops-&gt;status = ret;<!----></span><br><br>		if (copy_to_user(uparams, &params, sizeof(params)))<span class="line"><!---->		if (copy_to_user(uparams, &amp;params, sizeof(params)))<!----></span><br>			ret = -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->			ret = -EFAULT;<!----></span><br>		else<span class="line"><!---->		else<!----></span><br>			ret = 0;<span class="line"><!---->			ret = 0;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	return ret;<span class="line"><!---->	return ret;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<!----></span><br>					    u32 session_id)<span class="line"><!---->					    u32 session_id)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span class="line"><!---->	lockdep_assert_held(&amp;pxp-&gt;session_mutex);<!----></span><br><br>	if (!pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// [3]<span class="line"><!---->	if (!pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// [3]<!----></span><br>		return -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EINVAL;<!----></span><br><br>	if (pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->drmfile != drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->	if (pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;drmfile != drmfile)<!----></span><br>		return -EPERM;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EPERM;<!----></span><br><br>	pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->is_valid = true;<span class="line"><!---->	pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;is_valid = true;<!----></span><br><br>	return 0;<span class="line"><!---->	return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=387<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=387"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=387<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2]         Hi, one detail I want to add is that this vulnerability can not only lead to oob read, but also cause oob write, so it is possible to achieve kernel code execution by relying on this vulnerability individual<span class="line"><!---->Hi, one detail I want to add is that this vulnerability can not only lead to oob read, but also cause oob write, so it is possible to achieve kernel code execution by relying on this vulnerability individual<!----></span><br><br>int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<!----></span><br>					    u32 session_id)<span class="line"><!---->					    u32 session_id)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span class="line"><!---->	lockdep_assert_held(&amp;pxp-&gt;session_mutex);<!----></span><br><br>	if (!pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// oob read<span class="line"><!---->	if (!pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// oob read<!----></span><br>		return -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EINVAL;<!----></span><br><br>	if (pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->drmfile != drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->	if (pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;drmfile != drmfile)<!----></span><br>		return -EPERM;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EPERM;<!----></span><br><br>	pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->is_valid = true;            // oob write<span class="line"><!---->	pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;is_valid = true;            // oob write<!----></span><br><br>	return 0;<span class="line"><!---->	return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Jun 20 06:52:13 2023<!----></span><br><br>CHROMIUM: drm/i915/pxp: Validate pxp_tag inputs in PXP_OPS ioctls<span class="line"><!---->CHROMIUM: drm/i915/pxp: Validate pxp_tag inputs in PXP_OPS ioctls<!----></span><br><br>The functions intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_query_pxp_tag take in the<span class="line"><!---->The functions intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_query_pxp_tag take in the<!----></span><br>session_id via the user provided pxp_tag param.<span class="line"><!---->session_id via the user provided pxp_tag param.<!----></span><br><br>However, they are not comprehensively extracting and<span class="line"><!---->However, they are not comprehensively extracting and<!----></span><br>validating the session_id bit-field.<span class="line"><!---->validating the session_id bit-field.<!----></span><br><br>Add that validation step - extract the bitmask at the<span class="line"><!---->Add that validation step - extract the bitmask at         Hi, thanks for reaching out to request a response to your question. Re: c#36. This issue is in the Intel i915 GFX driver and and was assessed to result in OOB memory access in the GPU process. <span class="line"><!---->Hi, thanks for reaching out to request a response to your question. Re: c#36. This issue is in the Intel i915 GFX driver and and was assessed to result in OOB memory access in the GPU process. <!----></span><br>The reward amount decided upon for this issue is the reward amount for baseline reports for security issues resulting in GPU process memory corruption.<span class="line"><!---->The reward amount decided upon for this issue is the reward amount for baseline reports for security issues resulting in GPU process memory corruption.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        We have reassessed this issue based on that it OOB memory access is indeed in the kernel rather than the GPU process. Based on this we have decided to award you an additional $5,000 + $1,000 bisect bonus. Thanks for your patience for this to be reassessed and allowing us time to make it right!<span class="line"><!---->We have reassessed this issue based on that it OOB memory access is indeed in the kernel rather than the GPU process. Based on this we have decided to award you an additional $5,000 + $1,000 bisect bonus. Thanks for your patience for this to be reassessed and allowing us time to make it right!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          position: relative;

          padding: 0;

           * there's spacing. */

        for LitElement.

    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;

    cursor: pointer;

    /* Links that look like buttons. */

  }

  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {

          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }

          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }

            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

            position: static;
          }

            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>

 var loadQueue = [];

 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)

 delete loadQueue;
 };
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
</script>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open issue in new tab<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->x<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">

      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>IOCTL$I915_PXP_OPS will call i915_pxp_ops_ioctl to handle pxp ioctls. if *pxp_ops->action* is DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_ACTION_SET_SESSION_STATUS, it will call *pxp_set_session_status*. *params* is copied from userspace[1], which means *params* is under user control, including *params.pxp_tag*. If *params.req_session_state* is *DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY*, it will call *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*[2] with *params.pxp_tag*. There is no check about the *session_id*(*params.pxp_tag*) in *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*, and will cause out of bounds read/write.<span class="line"><!---->IOCTL$I915_PXP_OPS will call i915_pxp_ops_ioctl to handle pxp ioctls. if *pxp_ops-&gt;action* is DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_ACTION_SET_SESSION_STATUS, it will call *pxp_set_session_status*. *params* is copied from userspace[1], which means *params* is under user control, including *params.pxp_tag*. If *params.req_session_state* is *DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY*, it will call *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*[2] with *params.pxp_tag*. There is no check about the *session_id*(*params.pxp_tag*) in *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*, and will cause out of bounds read/write.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static int pxp_set_session_status(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->static int pxp_set_session_status(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>				  struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_ops *pxp_ops,<span class="line"><!---->				  struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_ops *pxp_ops,<!----></span><br>				  struct drm_file *drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->				  struct drm_file *drmfile)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params params;<span class="line"><!---->	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params params;<!----></span><br>	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params __user *uparams =<span class="line"><!---->	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params __user *uparams =<!----></span><br>		u64_to_user_ptr(pxp_ops->params);<span class="line"><!---->		u64_to_user_ptr(pxp_ops-&gt;params);<!----></span><br>	int ret = 0;<span class="line"><!---->	int ret = 0;<!----></span><br><br>	if (copy_from_user(&params, uparams, sizeof(params)) != 0)		// [1]<span class="line"><!---->	if (copy_from_user(&amp;params, uparams, sizeof(params)) != 0)		// [1]<!----></span><br>		return -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EFAULT;<!----></span><br><br>	switch (params.req_session_state) {<span class="line"><!---->	switch (params.req_session_state) {<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_ID_INIT:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_ID_INIT:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_reserve_session(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_reserve_session(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							 params.session_mode,<span class="line"><!---->							 params.session_mode,<!----></span><br>							 &params.pxp_tag);<span class="line"><!---->							 &amp;params.pxp_tag);<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							      params.pxp_tag);					// [2]<span class="line"><!---->							      params.pxp_tag);					// [2]<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_TERMINATE:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_TERMINATE:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_terminate_session(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_terminate_session(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							   params.pxp_tag);<span class="line"><!---->							   params.pxp_tag);<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	default:<span class="line"><!---->	default:<!----></span><br>		ret = -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		ret = -EINVAL;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	if (ret >= 0) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (ret &gt;= 0) {<!----></span><br>		pxp_ops->status = ret;<span class="line"><!---->		pxp_ops-&gt;status = ret;<!----></span><br><br>		if (copy_to_user(uparams, &params, sizeof(params)))<span class="line"><!---->		if (copy_to_user(uparams, &amp;params, sizeof(params)))<!----></span><br>			ret = -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->			ret = -EFAULT;<!----></span><br>		else<span class="line"><!---->		else<!----></span><br>			ret = 0;<span class="line"><!---->			ret = 0;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	return ret;<span class="line"><!---->	return ret;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<!----></span><br>					    u32 session_id)<span class="line"><!---->					    u32 session_id)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span class="line"><!---->	lockdep_assert_held(&amp;pxp-&gt;session_mutex);<!----></span><br><br>	if (!pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// [3]<span class="line"><!---->	if (!pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// [3]<!----></span><br>		return -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EINVAL;<!----></span><br><br>	if (pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->drmfile !=         Hi, one detail I want to add is that this vulnerability can not only lead to oob read, but also cause oob write, so it is possible to achieve kernel code execution by relying on this vulnerability individual<span class="line"><!---->Hi, one detail I want to add is that this vulnerability can not only lead to oob read, but also cause oob write, so it is possible to achieve kernel code execution by relying on this vulnerability individual<!----></span><br><br>int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<!----></span><br>					    u32 session_id)<span class="line"><!---->					    u32 session_id)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span class="line"><!---->	lockdep_assert_held(&amp;pxp-&gt;session_mutex);<!----></span><br><br>	if (!pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// oob read<span class="line"><!---->	if (!pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// oob read<!----></span><br>		return -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EINVAL;<!----></span><br><br>	if (pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->drmfile != drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->	if (pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;drmfile != drmfile)<!----></span><br>		return -EPERM;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EPERM;<!----></span><br><br>	pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->is_valid = true;            // oob write<span class="line"><!---->	pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;is_valid = true;            // oob write<!----></span><br><br>	return 0;<span class="line"><!---->	return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        So turn's out our branches were out of sync and Intel's tree already has a bounds check here.<span class="line"><!---->So turn's out our branches were out of sync and Intel's tree already has a bounds check here.<!----></span><br>Additionally though, they've now made a change so the masking is more consistent.<span class="line"><!---->Additionally though, they've now made a change so the masking is more consistent.<!----></span><br><br>I've posted CL's for affected kernels:<span class="line"><!---->I've posted CL's for affected kernels:<!----></span><br>5.4:  <span class="line"><!---->5.4:  <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/4567078<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/4567078"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/4567078<!----></a><br>5.10:  <span class="line"><!---->5.10:  <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/4567077<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/4567077"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/4567077<!----></a><br>5.15:  <span class="line"><!---->5.15:  <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/4567079<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/4567079"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/4567079<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi, thanks for reaching out to request a response to your question. Re: c#36. This issue is in the Intel i915 GFX driver and and was assessed to result in OOB memory access in the GPU process. <span class="line"><!---->Hi, thanks for reaching out to request a response to your question. Re: c#36. This issue is in the Intel i915 GFX driver and and was assessed to result in OOB memory access in the GPU process. <!----></span><br>The reward amount decided upon for this issue is the reward amount for baseline reports for security issues resulting in GPU process memory corruption.<span class="line"><!---->The reward amount decided upon for this issue is the reward amount for baseline reports for security issues resulting in GPU process memory corruption.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         We have reassessed this issue based on that it OOB memory access is indeed in the kernel rather than the GPU process. Based on this we have decided to award you an additional $5,000 + $1,000 bisect bonus. Thanks for your patience for this to be reassessed and allowing us time to make it right!<span class="line"><!---->We have reassessed this issue based on that it OOB memory access is indeed in the kernel rather than the GPU process. Based on this we have decided to award you an additional $5,000 + $1,000 bisect bonus. Thanks for your patience for this to be reassessed and allowing us time to make it right!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          padding: 0;

          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

         * is disabled for this component.

          position: relative;

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-direction: row;

          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

          mr-issue-metadata {

            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {

          }
        }

              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }

          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;

      </style>

 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }

 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;

    display: block;

  }

    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);

  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;

    align-items: flex-start;
  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;

      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);

    }
  }
