      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>IOCTL$I915_PXP_OPS will call i915_pxp_ops_ioctl to handle pxp ioctls. if *pxp_ops->action* is DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_ACTION_SET_SESSION_STATUS, it will call *pxp_set_session_status*. *params* is copied from userspace[1], which means *params* is under user control, including *params.pxp_tag*. If *params.req_session_state* is *DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY*, it will call *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*[2] with *params.pxp_tag*. There is no check about the *session_id*(*params.pxp_tag*) in *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*, and will cause out of bounds read/write.<span class="line"><!---->IOCTL$I915_PXP_OPS will call i915_pxp_ops_ioctl to handle pxp ioctls. if *pxp_ops-&gt;action* is DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_ACTION_SET_SESSION_STATUS, it will call *pxp_set_session_status*. *params* is copied from userspace[1], which means *params* is under user control, including *params.pxp_tag*. If *params.req_session_state* is *DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY*, it will call *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*[2] with *params.pxp_tag*. There is no check about the *session_id*(*params.pxp_tag*) in *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*, and will cause out of bounds read/write.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static int pxp_set_session_status(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->static int pxp_set_session_status(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>				  struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_ops *pxp_ops,<span class="line"><!---->				  struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_ops *pxp_ops,<!----></span><br>				  struct drm_file *drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->				  struct drm_file *drmfile)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params params;<span class="line"><!---->	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params params;<!----></span><br>	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params __user *uparams =<span class="line"><!---->	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params __user *uparams =<!----></span><br>		u64_to_user_ptr(pxp_ops->params);<span class="line"><!---->		u64_to_user_ptr(pxp_ops-&gt;params);<!----></span><br>	int ret = 0;<span class="line"><!---->	int ret = 0;<!----></span><br><br>	if (copy_from_user(&params, uparams, sizeof(params)) != 0)		// [1]<span class="line"><!---->	if (copy_from_user(&amp;params, uparams, sizeof(params)) != 0)		// [1]<!----></span><br>		return -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EFAULT;<!----></span><br><br>	switch (params.req_session_state) {<span class="line"><!---->	switch (params.req_session_state) {<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_ID_INIT:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_ID_INIT:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_reserve_session(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_reserve_session(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							 params.session_mode,<span class="line"><!---->							 params.session_mode,<!----></span><br>							 &params.pxp_tag);<span class="line"><!---->							 &amp;params.pxp_tag);<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							      params.pxp_tag);					// [2]<span class="line"><!---->							      params.pxp_tag);					// [2]<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_TERMINATE:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_TERMINATE:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_terminate_session(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_terminate_session(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							   params.pxp_tag);<span class="line"><!---->							   params.pxp_tag);<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	default:<span class="line"><!---->	default:<!----></span><br>		ret = -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		ret = -EINVAL;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	if (ret >= 0) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (ret &gt;= 0) {<!----></span><br>		pxp_ops->status = ret;<span class="line"><!---->		pxp_ops-&gt;status = ret;<!----></span><br><br>		if (copy_to_user(uparams, &params, sizeof(params)))<span class="line"><!---->		if (copy_to_user(uparams, &amp;params, sizeof(params)))<!----></span><br>			ret = -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->			ret = -EFAULT;<!----></span><br>		else<span class="line"><!---->		else<!----></span><br>			ret = 0;<span class="line"><!---->			ret = 0;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	return ret;<span class="line"><!---->	return ret;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<!----></span><br>					    u32 session_id)<span class="line"><!---->					    u32 session_id)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span class="line"><!---->	lockdep_assert_held(&amp;pxp-&gt;session_mutex);<!----></span><br><br>	if (!pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// [3]<span class="line"><!---->	if (!pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// [3]<!----></span><br>		return -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EINVAL;<!----></span><br><br>	if (pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->drmfile != drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->	if (pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;drmfile != drmfile)<!----></span><br>		return -EPERM;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EPERM;<!----></span><br><br>	pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->is_valid = true;<span class="line"><!---->	pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;is_valid = true;<!----></span><br><br>	return 0;<span class="line"><!---->	return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=387<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=387"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=387<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=397<a href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=397"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=397<!----></a><br>[3] dev<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>This issue is discovered by manual code review, I will try to construct a poc to reproduce it.<span problem.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c b/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c<span b/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c<!----></span><br>@@ -296,6 +296,8 @@ int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->@@ -296,6 +296,8 @@ int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br> {<span class="line"><!----> {<!----></span><br>        lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span         by

        Hi, one detail I want to add is that this vulnerability can not only lead to oob read, but also cause oob write, so it is possible to achieve kernel code execution by relying on this vulnerability individual<span class="line"><!---->Hi, one detail I want to add is that this vulnerability can not only lead to oob read, but also cause oob write, so it is possible to achieve kernel code execution by relying on this vulnerability individual<!----></span><br><br>int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<!----></span><br>					    u32 session_id)<span class="line"><!---->					    u32 session_id)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span class="line"><!---->	lockdep_assert_held(&amp;pxp-&gt;session_mutex);<!----></span><br><br>	if (!pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// oob read<span class="line"><!---->	if (!pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// oob read<!----></span><br>		return -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EINVAL;<!----></span><br><br>	if (pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->drmfile != drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->	if (pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;drmfile != drmfile)<!----></span><br>		return -EPERM;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EPERM;<!----></span><br><br>	pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->is_valid = true;            // oob write<span class="line"><!---->	pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;is_valid = true;            // oob write<!----></span><br><br>	return 0;<span class="line"><!---->	return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        justonli: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->justonli: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. If you've started working on a fix, please set the status to Started.<span class="line"><!---->If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. If you've started working on a fix, please set the status to Started.<!----></span><br><br>Thanks for your time! To disable nags, add the Disable-Nags label.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for your time! To disable nags, add the Disable-Nags label.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.           -reward-unpaid reward-inprocess
          
          <br>

        Hi, thanks for reaching out to request a response to your question. Re: c#36. This issue is in the Intel i915 GFX driver and and was assessed to result in OOB memory access in the GPU process. <span class="line"><!---->Hi, thanks for reaching out to request a response to your question. Re: c#36. This issue is in the Intel i915 GFX driver and and was assessed to result in OOB memory access in the GPU process. <!----></span><br>The reward amount decided upon for this issue is the reward amount for baseline reports for security issues resulting in GPU process memory corruption.<span class="line"><!---->The reward amount decided upon for this issue is the reward amount for baseline reports for security issues resulting in GPU process memory corruption.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        We have reassessed this issue based on that it OOB memory access is indeed in the kernel rather than the GPU process. Based on this we have decided to award you an additional $5,000 + $1,000 bisect bonus. Thanks for your patience for this to be reassessed and allowing us time to make it right!<span class="line"><!---->We have reassessed this issue based on that it OOB memory access is indeed in the kernel rather than the GPU process. Based on this we have decided to award you an additional $5,000 + $1,000 bisect bonus. Thanks for your patience for this to be reassessed and allowing us time to make it right!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Add attachments

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      </i>
      
        warning
      <i class="warning-icon material-icons" icon="warning" hidden="" title="">
        warning
      </i>
      
    <mr-restriction-indicator hidden=""></mr-restriction-indicator>
              
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      warning<i class="warning-icon material-icons" icon="warning">warning</i>
      This issue has been migrated to Launch, see link in final comment below.<p>This issue has been migrated to Launch, see link in final comment below.</p>
    <mr-migrated-banner hidden=""></mr-migrated-banner>

        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>IOCTL$I915_PXP_OPS will call i915_pxp_ops_ioctl to handle pxp ioctls. if *pxp_ops->action* is DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_ACTION_SET_SESSION_STATUS, it will call *pxp_set_session_status*. *params* is copied from userspace[1], which means *params* is under user control, including *params.pxp_tag*. If *params.req_session_state* is *DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY*, it will call *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*[2] with *params.pxp_tag*. There is no check about the *session_id*(*params.pxp_tag*) in *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*, and will cause out of bounds read/write.<span class="line"><!---->IOCTL$I915_PXP_OPS will call i915_pxp_ops_ioctl to handle pxp ioctls. if *pxp_ops-&gt;action* is DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_ACTION_SET_SESSION_STATUS, it will call *pxp_set_session_status*. *params* is copied from userspace[1], which means *params* is under user control, including *params.pxp_tag*. If *params.req_session_state* is *DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY*, it will call *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*[2] with *params.pxp_tag*. There is no check about the *session_id*(*params.pxp_tag*) in *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*, and will cause out of bounds read/write.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static int pxp_set_session_status(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->static int pxp_set_session_status(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>				  struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_ops *pxp_ops,<span class="line"><!---->				  struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_ops *pxp_ops,<!----></span><br>				  struct drm_file *drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->				  struct drm_file *drmfile)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params params;<span class="line"><!---->	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params params;<!----></span><br>	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params __user *uparams =<span class="line"><!---->	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params __user *uparams =<!----></span><br>		u64_to_user_ptr(pxp_ops->params);<span class="line"><!---->		u64_to_user_ptr(pxp_ops-&gt;params);<!----></span><br>	int ret = 0;<span class="line"><!---->	int ret = 0;<!----></span><br><br>	if (copy_from_user(&params, uparams, sizeof(params)) != 0)		// [1]<span class="line"><!---->	if (copy_from_user(&amp;params, uparams, sizeof(params)) != 0)		// [1]<!----></span><br>		return -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EFAULT;<!----></span><br><br>	switch (params.req_session_state) {<span class="line"><!---->	switch (params.req_session_state) {<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_ID_INIT:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_ID_INIT:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_reserve_session(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_reserve_session(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							 params.session_mode,<span class="line"><!---->							 params.session_mode,<!----></span><br>							 &params.pxp_tag);<span class="line"><!---->							 &amp;params.pxp_tag);<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							      params.pxp_tag);					// [2]<span class="line"><!---->							      params.pxp_tag);					// [2]<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_TERMINATE:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_TERMINATE:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_terminate_session(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_terminate_session(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							   params.pxp_tag);<span class="line"><!---->							   params.pxp_tag);<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	default:<span class="line"><!---->	default:<!----></span><br>		ret = -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		ret = -EINVAL;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	if (ret >= 0) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (ret &gt;= 0) {<!----></span><br>		pxp_ops->status = ret;<span class="line"><!---->		pxp_ops-&gt;status = ret;<!----></span><br><br>		if (copy_to_user(uparams, &params, sizeof(params)))<span class="line"><!---->		if (copy_to_user(uparams, &amp;params, sizeof(params)))<!----></span><br>			ret = -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->			ret = -EFAULT;<!----></span><br>		else<span class="line"><!---->		else<!----></span><br>			ret = 0;<span class="line"><!---->			ret = 0;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	return ret;<span class="line"><!---->	return ret;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<!----></span><br>					    u32 session_id)<span class="line"><!---->					    u32 session_id)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span class="line"><!---->	lockdep_assert_held(&amp;pxp-&gt;session_mutex);<!----></span><br><br>	if (!pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// [3]<span class="line"><!---->	if (!pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// [3]<!----></span><br>		return -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EINVAL;<!----></span><br><br>	if (pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->drmfile != drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->	if (pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;drmfile != drmfile)<!----></span><br>		return -EPERM;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EPERM;<!----></span><br><br>	pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->is_valid = true;<span class="line"><!---->	pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;is_valid = true;<!----></span><br><br>	return 0;<span class="line"><!---->	return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=387<a         by

        lm0963hack@gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/lm0963hack@gmail.com"><!---->lm0963hack@gmail.com<!----></a> sorry for the delay. You are right. This bug is in code that Intel contributes to ChromeOS kernel to support a closed source user space driver (and will not be accepted upstream).         Hi, one detail I want to add is that this vulnerability can not only lead to oob read, but also cause oob write, so it is possible to achieve kernel code execution by relying on this vulnerability individual<span class="line"><!---->Hi, one detail I want to add is that this vulnerability can not only lead to oob read, but also cause oob write, so it is possible to achieve kernel code execution by relying on this vulnerability individual<!----></span><br><br>int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<!----></span><br>					    u32 session_id)<span class="line"><!---->					    u32 session_id)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span class="line"><!---->	lockdep_assert_held(&amp;pxp-&gt;session_mutex);<!----></span><br><br>	if (!pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// oob read<span class="line"><!---->	if (!pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// oob read<!----></span><br>		return -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EINVAL;<!----></span><br><br>	if (pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->drmfile != drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->	if (pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;drmfile != drmfile)<!----></span><br>		return -EPERM;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EPERM;<!----></span><br><br>	pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->is_valid = true;            // oob write<span class="line"><!---->	pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;is_valid = true;            // oob write<!----></span><br><br>	return 0;<span class="line"><!---->	return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Hi, thanks for reaching out to request a response to your question. Re: c#36. This issue is in the Intel i915 GFX driver and and was assessed to result in OOB memory access in the GPU process. <span class="line"><!---->Hi, thanks for reaching out to request a response to your question. Re: c#36. This issue is in the Intel i915 GFX driver and and was assessed to result in OOB memory access in the GPU process. <!----></span><br>The reward amount decided upon for this issue is the reward amount for baseline reports for security issues resulting in GPU process memory corruption.<span class="line"><!---->The reward amount decided upon for this issue is the reward amount for baseline reports for security issues resulting in GPU process memory corruption.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        We have reassessed this issue based on that it OOB memory access is indeed in the kernel rather than the GPU process. Based on this we have decided to award you an additional $5,000 + $1,000 bisect bonus. Thanks for your patience for this to be reassessed and allowing us time to make it right!<span class="line"><!---->We have reassessed this issue based on that it OOB memory access is indeed in the kernel rather than the GPU process. Based on this we have decided to award you an additional $5,000 + $1,000 bisect bonus. Thanks for your patience for this to be reassessed and allowing us time to make it right!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1423627: Security: OOB Access in intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1423627: Security: OOB Access in intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      lm096...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/3761508586" title="lm096...@gmail.com"><!---->lm096...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      lm096...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->lm096...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Sat, Mar 11, 2023, 7:20 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Sat, Mar 11, 2023, 7:20 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>

          <h1>
            
            Issue 1423627: Security: OOB Access in intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">

            Reported by

        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)

      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>IOCTL$I915_PXP_OPS will call i915_pxp_ops_ioctl to handle pxp ioctls. if *pxp_ops->action* is DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_ACTION_SET_SESSION_STATUS, it will call *pxp_set_session_status*. *params* is copied from userspace[1], which means *params* is under user control, including *params.pxp_tag*. If *params.req_session_state* is *DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY*, it will call *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*[2] with *params.pxp_tag*. There is no check about the *session_id*(*params.pxp_tag*) in *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*, and will cause out of bounds read/write.<span class="line"><!---->IOCTL$I915_PXP_OPS will call i915_pxp_ops_ioctl to handle pxp ioctls. if *pxp_ops-&gt;action* is DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_ACTION_SET_SESSION_STATUS, it will call *pxp_set_session_status*. *params* is copied from userspace[1], which means *params* is under user control, including *params.pxp_tag*. If *params.req_session_state* is *DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY*, it will call *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*[2] with *params.pxp_tag*. There is no check about the *session_id*(*params.pxp_tag*) in *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*, and will cause out of bounds read/write.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static int pxp_set_session_status(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->static int pxp_set_session_status(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>				  struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_ops *pxp_ops,<span class="line"><!---->				  struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_ops *pxp_ops,<!----></span><br>				  struct drm_file *drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->				  struct drm_file *drmfile)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params params;<span class="line"><!---->	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params params;<!----></span><br>	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params __user *uparams =<span class="line"><!---->	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params __user *uparams =<!----></span><br>		u64_to_user_ptr(pxp_ops->params);<span class="line"><!---->		u64_to_user_ptr(pxp_ops-&gt;params);<!----></span><br>	int ret = 0;<span class="line"><!---->	int ret = 0;<!----></span><br><br>	if (copy_from_user(&params, uparams, sizeof(params)) != 0)		// [1]<span class="line"><!---->	if (copy_from_user(&amp;params, uparams, sizeof(params)) != 0)		// [1]<!----></span><br>		return -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EFAULT;<!----></span><br><br>	switch (params.req_session_state) {<span class="line"><!---->	switch (params.req_session_state) {<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_ID_INIT:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_ID_INIT:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_reserve_session(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_reserve_session(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							 params.session_mode,<span class="line"><!---->							 params.session_mode,<!----></span><br>							 &params.pxp_tag);<span class="line"><!---->							 &amp;params.pxp_tag);<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							      params.pxp_tag);					// [2]<span class="line"><!---->							      params.pxp_tag);					// [2]<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_TERMINATE:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_TERMINATE:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_terminate_session(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_terminate_session(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							   params.pxp_tag);<span class="line"><!---->							   params.pxp_tag);<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	default:<span class="line"><!---->	default:<!----></span><br>		ret = -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		ret = -EINVAL;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	if (ret >= 0) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (ret &gt;= 0) {<!----></span><br>		pxp_ops->status = ret;<span class="line"><!---->		pxp_ops-&gt;status = ret;<!----></span><br><br>		if (copy_to_user(uparams, &params, sizeof(params)))<span class="line"><!---->		if (copy_to_user(uparams, &amp;params, sizeof(params)))<!----></span><br>			ret = -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->			ret = -EFAULT;<!----></span><br>		else<span class="line"><!---->		else<!----></span><br>			ret = 0;<span class="line"><!---->			ret = 0;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	return ret;<span class="line"><!---->	return ret;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<!----></span><br>					    u32 session_id)<span class="line"><!---->					    u32 session_id)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span class="line"><!---->	lockdep_assert_held(&amp;pxp-&gt;session_mutex);<!----></span><br><br>	if (!pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// [3]<span class="line"><!---->	if (!pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// [3]<!----></span><br>		return -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EINVAL;<!----></span><br><br>	if (pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->drmfile != drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->	if (pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;drmfile != drmfile)<!----></span><br>		return -EPERM;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EPERM;<!----></span><br><br>	pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->is_valid = true;<span class="line"><!---->	pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;is_valid = true;<!----></span><br><br>	return 0;<span class="line"><!---->	return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=387<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=387"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=387<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=397<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=397"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=397<!----></a><br>[3] <span class="line"><!---->[3] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=299<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=299"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=299<!----></a><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Operating System: ChromiumOS Kernel 5.15 stable + dev<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: ChromiumOS Kernel 5.15 stable + dev<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>This issue is discovered by manual code review, I will try to construct a poc to reproduce it.<span class="line"><!---->This issue is discovered by manual code review, I will try to construct a poc to reproduce it.<!----></span><br><br><br>Bisect<span PATCH SUGGESTION<span class="line"><!---->FIX PATCH SUGGESTION<!----></span><br>I think the follwing patch should fix the problem.<span class="line"><!---->I think the follwing patch should fix the problem.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c b/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c<span a/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c<!----></span><br>+++ b/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c<!----></span><br>@@ -296,6 +296,8 @@ int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->@@ -296,6 +296,8 @@ int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br> {<span class="line"><!----> {<!----></span><br>        lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_TAG_SESSION_ID_MASK;<span class="line"><!---->+       session_id = session_id &amp; DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_TAG_SESSION_ID_MASK;<!----></span><br>+<span         <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1423627#c2">Comment 2<!----></a>

        Hi, one detail I want to add is that this vulnerability can not only lead to oob read, but also cause oob write, so it is possible to achieve kernel code execution by relying on this vulnerability individual<span class="line"><!---->Hi, one detail I want to add is that this vulnerability can not only lead to oob read, but also cause oob write, so it is possible to achieve kernel code execution by relying on this vulnerability individual<!----></span><br><br>int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<!----></span><br>					    u32 session_id)<span class="line"><!---->					    u32 session_id)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span class="line"><!---->	lockdep_assert_held(&amp;pxp-&gt;session_mutex);<!----></span><br><br>	if (!pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// oob read<span class="line"><!---->	if (!pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// oob read<!----></span><br>		return -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EINVAL;<!----></span><br><br>	if (pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->drmfile != drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->	if (pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;drmfile != drmfile)<!----></span><br>		return -EPERM;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EPERM;<!----></span><br><br>	pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->is_valid = true;            // oob write<span class="line"><!---->	pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;is_valid = true;            // oob write<!----></span><br><br>	return 0;<span class="line"><!---->	return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Hi, thanks for reaching out to request a response to your question. Re: c#36. This issue is in the Intel i915 GFX driver and and was assessed to result in OOB memory access in the GPU process. <span class="line"><!---->Hi, thanks for reaching out to request a response to your question. Re: c#36. This issue is in the Intel i915 GFX driver and and was assessed to result in OOB memory access in the GPU process. <!----></span><br>The reward amount decided upon for this issue is the reward amount for baseline reports for security issues resulting in GPU process memory corruption.<span class="line"><!---->The reward amount decided upon for this issue is the reward amount for baseline reports for security issues resulting in GPU process memory corruption.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        We have reassessed this issue based on that it OOB memory access is indeed in the kernel rather than the GPU process. Based on this we have decided to award you an additional $5,000 + $1,000 bisect bonus. Thanks for your patience for this to be reassessed and allowing us time to make it right!<span class="line"><!---->We have reassessed this issue based on that it OOB memory access is indeed in the kernel rather than the GPU process. Based on this we have decided to award you an additional $5,000 + $1,000 bisect bonus. Thanks for your patience for this to be reassessed and allowing us time to make it right!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>IOCTL$I915_PXP_OPS will call i915_pxp_ops_ioctl to handle pxp ioctls. if *pxp_ops->action* is DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_ACTION_SET_SESSION_STATUS, it will call *pxp_set_session_status*. *params* is copied from userspace[1], which means *params* is under user control, including *params.pxp_tag*. If *params.req_session_state* is *DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY*, it will call *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*[2] with *params.pxp_tag*. There is no check about the *session_id*(*params.pxp_tag*) in *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*, and will cause out of bounds read/write.<span class="line"><!---->IOCTL$I915_PXP_OPS will call i915_pxp_ops_ioctl to handle pxp ioctls. if *pxp_ops-&gt;action* is DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_ACTION_SET_SESSION_STATUS, it will call *pxp_set_session_status*. *params* is copied from userspace[1], which means *params* is under user control, including *params.pxp_tag*. If *params.req_session_state* is *DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY*, it will call *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*[2] with *params.pxp_tag*. There is no check about the *session_id*(*params.pxp_tag*) in *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*, and will cause out of bounds read/write.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static int pxp_set_session_status(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->static int pxp_set_session_status(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>				  struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_ops *pxp_ops,<span class="line"><!---->				  struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_ops *pxp_ops,<!----></span><br>				  struct drm_file *drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->				  struct drm_file *drmfile)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params params;<span class="line"><!---->	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params params;<!----></span><br>	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params __user *uparams =<span class="line"><!---->	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params __user *uparams =<!----></span><br>		u64_to_user_ptr(pxp_ops->params);<span class="line"><!---->		u64_to_user_ptr(pxp_ops-&gt;params);<!----></span><br>	int ret = 0;<span class="line"><!---->	int ret = 0;<!----></span><br><br>	if (copy_from_user(&params, uparams, sizeof(params)) != 0)		// [1]<span class="line"><!---->	if (copy_from_user(&amp;params, uparams, sizeof(params)) != 0)		// [1]<!----></span><br>		return -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EFAULT;<!----></span><br><br>	switch (params.req_session_state) {<span class="line"><!---->	switch (params.req_session_state) {<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_ID_INIT:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_ID_INIT:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_reserve_session(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_reserve_session(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							 params.session_mode,<span class="line"><!---->							 params.session_mode,<!----></span><br>							 &params.pxp_tag);<span class="line"><!---->							 &amp;params.pxp_tag);<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							      params.pxp_tag);					// [2]<span class="line"><!---->							      params.pxp_tag);					// [2]<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_TERMINATE:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_TERMINATE:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_terminate_session(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_terminate_session(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							   params.pxp_tag);<span class="line"><!---->							   params.pxp_tag);<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	default:<span class="line"><!---->	default:<!----></span><br>		ret = -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		ret = -EINVAL;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	if (ret >= 0) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (ret &gt;= 0) {<!----></span><br>		pxp_ops->status = ret;<span class="line"><!---->		pxp_ops-&gt;status = ret;<!----></span><br><br>		if (copy_to_user(uparams, &params, sizeof(params)))<span class="line"><!---->		if (copy_to_user(uparams, &amp;params, sizeof(params)))<!----></span><br>			ret = -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->			ret = -EFAULT;<!----></span><br>		else<span class="line"><!---->		else<!----></span><br>			ret = 0;<span class="line"><!---->			ret = 0;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	return ret;<span class="line"><!---->	return ret;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<!----></span><br>					    u32 session_id)<span class="line"><!---->					    u32 session_id)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span class="line"><!---->	lockdep_assert_held(&amp;pxp-&gt;session_mutex);<!----></span><br><br>	if (!pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// [3]<span class="line"><!---->	if (!pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// [3]<!----></span><br>		return -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EINVAL;<!----></span><br><br>	if (pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->drmfile != drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->	if (pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;drmfile != drmfile)<!----></span><br>		return -EPERM;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EPERM;<!----></span><br><br>	pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->is_valid = true;<span class="line"><!---->	pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;is_valid = true;<!----></span><br><br>	return 0;<span class="line"><!---->	return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=387<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=387"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=387<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=397<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=397"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=397<!----></a><br>[3] <span class="line"><!---->[3] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=299<a href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=299"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/chromiumos/codesearch/+/main:src/third_party/kernel/v5.15/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c;drc=bf2e50dad9f01012f624d90344cba3337861a5e7;l=299<!----></a><br><br><br>VERSION<b dev<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>This issue is discovered by manual code review, I will try to construct a poc to reproduce it.<span class="line"><!---->This issue is discovered by manual code review, I will try to construct a poc to reproduce it.<!----></span><br><br><br>Bisect<span href="https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/_/chromium/chromiumos/third_party/kernel/+/4ee107d70597cc94b1c48ecf2b5629232955f32b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromiumos/_/chromium/chromiumos/third_party/kernel/+/4ee107d70597cc94b1c48ecf2b5629232955f32b<!----></a><br><br><br>FIX PATCH SUGGESTION<span class="line"><!---->FIX PATCH SUGGESTION<!----></span><br>I think the follwing patch should fix the problem.<span class="line"><!---->I think the follwing patch should fix the problem.<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>diff --git a/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c b/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c<span a/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c<!----></span><br>+++ b/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c<span class="line"><!---->+++ b/drivers/gpu/drm/i915/pxp/intel_pxp_session.c<!----></span><br>@@ -296,6 +296,8 @@ int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->@@ -296,6 +296,8 @@ int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br> {<span class="line"><!----> {<!----></span><br>        lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span         Hi, one detail I want to add is that this vulnerability can not only lead to oob read, but also cause oob write, so it is possible to achieve kernel code execution by relying on this vulnerability individual<span class="line"><!---->Hi, one detail I want to add is that this vulnerability can not only lead to oob read, but also cause oob write, so it is possible to achieve kernel code execution by relying on this vulnerability individual<!----></span><br><br>int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<!----></span><br>					    u32 session_id)<span class="line"><!---->					    u32 session_id)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span class="line"><!---->	lockdep_assert_held(&amp;pxp-&gt;session_mutex);<!----></span><br><br>	if (!pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// oob read<span class="line"><!---->	if (!pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// oob read<!----></span><br>		return -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EINVAL;<!----></span><br><br>	if (pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->drmfile != drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->	if (pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;drmfile != drmfile)<!----></span><br>		return -EPERM;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EPERM;<!----></span><br><br>	pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->is_valid = true;            // oob write<span class="line"><!---->	pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;is_valid = true;            // oob write<!----></span><br><br>	return 0;<span class="line"><!---->	return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        justonli: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->justonli: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Hi, thanks for reaching out to request a response to your question. Re: c#36. This issue is in the Intel i915 GFX driver and and was assessed to result in OOB memory access in the GPU process. <span class="line"><!---->Hi, thanks for reaching out to request a response to your question. Re: c#36.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         We have reassessed this issue based on that it OOB memory access is indeed in the kernel rather than the GPU process. Based on this we have decided to award you an additional $5,000 + $1,000 bisect bonus. Thanks for your patience for this to be reassessed and allowing us time to make it right!<span class="line"><!---->We have reassessed this issue based on that it OOB memory access is indeed in the kernel rather than the GPU process. Based on this we have decided to award you an additional $5,000 + $1,000 bisect bonus.
