        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>IOCTL$I915_PXP_OPS will call i915_pxp_ops_ioctl to handle pxp ioctls. if *pxp_ops->action* is DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_ACTION_SET_SESSION_STATUS, it will call *pxp_set_session_status*. *params* is copied from userspace[1], which means *params* is under user control, including *params.pxp_tag*. If *params.req_session_state* is *DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY*, it will call *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*[2] with *params.pxp_tag*. There is no check about the *session_id*(*params.pxp_tag*) in *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*, and will cause out of bounds read/write.<span class="line"><!---->IOCTL$I915_PXP_OPS will call i915_pxp_ops_ioctl to handle pxp ioctls. if *pxp_ops-&gt;action* is DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_ACTION_SET_SESSION_STATUS, it will call *pxp_set_session_status*. *params* is copied from userspace[1], which means *params* is under user control, including *params.pxp_tag*. If *params.req_session_state* is *DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY*, it will call *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*[2] with *params.pxp_tag*. There is no check about the *session_id*(*params.pxp_tag*) in *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*, and will cause out of bounds read/write.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static int pxp_set_session_status(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->static int pxp_set_session_status(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>				  struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_ops *pxp_ops,<span class="line"><!---->				  struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_ops *pxp_ops,<!----></span><br>				  struct drm_file *drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->				  struct drm_file *drmfile)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params params;<span class="line"><!---->	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params params;<!----></span><br>	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params __user *uparams =<span class="line"><!---->	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params __user *uparams =<!----></span><br>		u64_to_user_ptr(pxp_ops->params);<span class="line"><!---->		u64_to_user_ptr(pxp_ops-&gt;params);<!----></span><br>	int ret = 0;<span class="line"><!---->	int ret = 0;<!----></span><br><br>	if (copy_from_user(&params, uparams, sizeof(params)) != 0)		// [1]<span class="line"><!---->	if (copy_from_user(&amp;params, uparams, sizeof(params)) != 0)		// [1]<!----></span><br>		return -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EFAULT;<!----></span><br><br>	switch (params.req_session_state) {<span class="line"><!---->	switch (params.req_session_state) {<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_ID_INIT:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_ID_INIT:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_reserve_session(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_reserve_session(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							 params.session_mode,<span class="line"><!---->							 params.session_mode,<!----></span><br>							 &params.pxp_tag);<span class="line"><!---->							 &amp;params.pxp_tag);<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							      params.pxp_tag);					// [2]<span class="line"><!---->							      params.pxp_tag);					// [2]<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_TERMINATE:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_TERMINATE:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_terminate_session(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_terminate_session(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							   params.pxp_tag);<span class="line"><!---->							   params.pxp_tag);<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	default:<span class="line"><!---->	default:<!----></span><br>		ret = -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		ret = -EINVAL;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	if (ret >= 0) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (ret &gt;= 0) {<!----></span><br>		pxp_ops->status = ret;<span class="line"><!---->		pxp_ops-&gt;status = ret;<!----></span><br><br>		if (copy_to_user(uparams, &params, sizeof(params)))<span class="line"><!---->		if (copy_to_user(uparams, &amp;params, sizeof(params)))<!----></span><br>			ret = -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->			ret = -EFAULT;<!----></span><br>		else<span class="line"><!---->		else<!----></span><br>			ret = 0;<span class="line"><!---->			ret = 0;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	return ret;<span class="line"><!---->	return ret;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<!----></span><br>					    u32 session_id)<span class="line"><!---->					    u32 session_id)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span class="line"><!---->	lockdep_assert_held(&amp;pxp-&gt;session_mutex);<!----></span><br><br>	if (!pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// [3]<span class="line"><!---->	if (!pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// [3]<!----></span><br>		return -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EINVAL;<!----></span><br><br>	if (pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->drmfile != drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->	if (pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;drmfile != drmfile)<!----></span><br>		return -EPERM;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EPERM;<!----></span><br><br>	pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->is_valid = true;<span class="line"><!---->	pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;is_valid = true;<!----></span><br><br>	return 0;<span class="line"><!---->	return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1]         lm0963hack@gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/lm0963hack@gmail.com"><!---->lm0963hack@gmail.com<!----></a> sorry for the delay. You are right. This bug is in code that Intel contributes to ChromeOS kernel to support a closed source user space driver (and will not be accepted upstream). We will go ahead and fix it ourselves v. asking Intel to contribute the fix but we do need to run the fix past Intel so there may be a delay in the fix.<span class="line"><!----> sorry for the delay.         <chops-timestamp title="Thu, May 25, 2023, 8:54 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1423627#c23">Comment 23<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, May 25, 2023, 8:54 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Hi, one detail I want to add is that this vulnerability can not only lead to oob read, but also cause oob write, so it is possible to achieve kernel code execution by relying on this vulnerability individual<span class="line"><!---->Hi, one detail I want to add is that this vulnerability can not only lead to oob read, but also cause oob write, so it is possible to achieve kernel code execution by relying on this vulnerability individual<!----></span><br><br>int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<!----></span><br>					    u32 session_id)<span class="line"><!---->					    u32 session_id)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span class="line"><!---->	lockdep_assert_held(&amp;pxp-&gt;session_mutex);<!----></span><br><br>	if (!pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// oob read<span class="line"><!---->	if (!pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// oob read<!----></span><br>		return -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EINVAL;<!----></span><br><br>	if (pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->drmfile != drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->	if (pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;drmfile != drmfile)<!----></span><br>		return -EPERM;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EPERM;<!----></span><br><br>	pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->is_valid = true;            // oob write<span class="line"><!---->	pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;is_valid = true;            // oob write<!----></span><br><br>	return 0;<span class="line"><!---->	return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi, thanks for reaching out to request a response to your question. Re: c#36. This issue is in the Intel i915 GFX driver and and was assessed to result in OOB memory access in the GPU process. <span class="line"><!---->Hi, thanks for reaching out to request a response to your question. Re: c#36. This issue is in the Intel i915 GFX driver and and was assessed to result in OOB memory access in the GPU process. <!----></span><br>The reward amount decided upon for this issue is the reward amount for baseline reports for security issues resulting in GPU process memory corruption.<span class="line"><!---->The reward amount decided upon for this issue is the reward amount for baseline reports for security issues resulting in GPU process memory corruption.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        We have reassessed this issue based on that it OOB memory access is indeed in the kernel rather than the GPU process. Based on this we have decided to award you an additional $5,000 + $1,000 bisect bonus. Thanks for your patience for this to be reassessed and allowing us time to make it right!<span class="line"><!---->We have reassessed this issue based on that it OOB memory access is indeed in the kernel rather than the GPU process. Based on this we have decided to award you an additional $5,000 + $1,000 bisect bonus. Thanks for your patience for this to be reassessed and allowing us time to make it right!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by lm096...@gmail.com (Mar 11, 2023)

      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>IOCTL$I915_PXP_OPS will call i915_pxp_ops_ioctl to handle pxp ioctls. if *pxp_ops->action* is DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_ACTION_SET_SESSION_STATUS, it will call *pxp_set_session_status*. *params* is copied from userspace[1], which means *params* is under user control, including *params.pxp_tag*. If *params.req_session_state* is *DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY*, it will call *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*[2] with *params.pxp_tag*. There is no check about the *session_id*(*params.pxp_tag*) in *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*, and will cause out of bounds read/write.<span class="line"><!---->IOCTL$I915_PXP_OPS will call i915_pxp_ops_ioctl to handle pxp ioctls. if *pxp_ops-&gt;action* is DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_ACTION_SET_SESSION_STATUS, it will call *pxp_set_session_status*. *params* is copied from userspace[1], which means *params* is under user control, including *params.pxp_tag*. If *params.req_session_state* is *DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY*, it will call *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*[2] with *params.pxp_tag*. There is no check about the *session_id*(*params.pxp_tag*) in *intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play*, and will cause out of bounds read/write.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>static int pxp_set_session_status(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->static int pxp_set_session_status(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>				  struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_ops *pxp_ops,<span class="line"><!---->				  struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_ops *pxp_ops,<!----></span><br>				  struct drm_file *drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->				  struct drm_file *drmfile)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params params;<span class="line"><!---->	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params params;<!----></span><br>	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params __user *uparams =<span class="line"><!---->	struct downstream_drm_i915_pxp_set_session_status_params __user *uparams =<!----></span><br>		u64_to_user_ptr(pxp_ops->params);<span class="line"><!---->		u64_to_user_ptr(pxp_ops-&gt;params);<!----></span><br>	int ret = 0;<span class="line"><!---->	int ret = 0;<!----></span><br><br>	if (copy_from_user(&params, uparams, sizeof(params)) != 0)		// [1]<span class="line"><!---->	if (copy_from_user(&amp;params, uparams, sizeof(params)) != 0)		// [1]<!----></span><br>		return -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EFAULT;<!----></span><br><br>	switch (params.req_session_state) {<span class="line"><!---->	switch (params.req_session_state) {<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_ID_INIT:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_ID_INIT:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_reserve_session(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_reserve_session(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							 params.session_mode,<span class="line"><!---->							 params.session_mode,<!----></span><br>							 &params.pxp_tag);<span class="line"><!---->							 &amp;params.pxp_tag);<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_IN_PLAY:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							      params.pxp_tag);					// [2]<span class="line"><!---->							      params.pxp_tag);					// [2]<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_TERMINATE:<span class="line"><!---->	case DOWNSTREAM_DRM_I915_PXP_REQ_SESSION_TERMINATE:<!----></span><br>		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_terminate_session(pxp, drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->		ret = intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_terminate_session(pxp, drmfile,<!----></span><br>							   params.pxp_tag);<span class="line"><!---->							   params.pxp_tag);<!----></span><br>		break;<span class="line"><!---->		break;<!----></span><br>	default:<span class="line"><!---->	default:<!----></span><br>		ret = -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		ret = -EINVAL;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	if (ret >= 0) {<span class="line"><!---->	if (ret &gt;= 0) {<!----></span><br>		pxp_ops->status = ret;<span class="line"><!---->		pxp_ops-&gt;status = ret;<!----></span><br><br>		if (copy_to_user(uparams, &params, sizeof(params)))<span class="line"><!---->		if (copy_to_user(uparams, &amp;params, sizeof(params)))<!----></span><br>			ret = -EFAULT;<span class="line"><!---->			ret = -EFAULT;<!----></span><br>		else<span class="line"><!---->		else<!----></span><br>			ret = 0;<span class="line"><!---->			ret = 0;<!----></span><br>	}<span class="line"><!---->	}<!----></span><br><br>	return ret;<span class="line"><!---->	return ret;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<!----></span><br>					    u32 session_id)<span class="line"><!---->					    u32 session_id)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span class="line"><!---->	lockdep_assert_held(&amp;pxp-&gt;session_mutex);<!----></span><br><br>	if (!pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// [3]<span class="line"><!---->	if (!pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// [3]<!----></span><br>		return -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EINVAL;<!----></span><br><br>	if (pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->drmfile != drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->	if (pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;drmfile != drmfile)<!----></span><br>		return -EPERM;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EPERM;<!----></span><br><br>	pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->is_valid = true;<span class="line"><!---->	pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;is_valid = true;<!----></span><br><br>	return 0;<span class="line"><!---->	return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1]         Hi, one detail I want to add is that this vulnerability can not only lead to oob read, but also cause oob write, so it is possible to achieve kernel code execution by relying on this vulnerability individual<span class="line"><!---->Hi, one detail I want to add is that this vulnerability can not only lead to oob read, but also cause oob write, so it is possible to achieve kernel code execution by relying on this vulnerability individual<!----></span><br><br>int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<span class="line"><!---->int intel_pxp_sm_ioctl_mark_session_in_play(struct intel_pxp *pxp,<!----></span><br>					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<span class="line"><!---->					    struct drm_file *drmfile,<!----></span><br>					    u32 session_id)<span class="line"><!---->					    u32 session_id)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>	lockdep_assert_held(&pxp->session_mutex);<span class="line"><!---->	lockdep_assert_held(&amp;pxp-&gt;session_mutex);<!----></span><br><br>	if (!pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// oob read<span class="line"><!---->	if (!pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id])						// oob read<!----></span><br>		return -EINVAL;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EINVAL;<!----></span><br><br>	if (pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->drmfile != drmfile)<span class="line"><!---->	if (pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;drmfile != drmfile)<!----></span><br>		return -EPERM;<span class="line"><!---->		return -EPERM;<!----></span><br><br>	pxp->hwdrm_sessions[session_id]->is_valid = true;            // oob write<span class="line"><!---->	pxp-&gt;hwdrm_sessions[session_id]-&gt;is_valid = true;            // oob write<!----></span><br><br>	return 0;<span class="line"><!---->	return 0;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        justonli: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->justonli: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. If you've started working on a fix, please set the status to Started.<span class="line"><!---->If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. If you've started working on a fix, please set the status to Started.<!----></span><br><br>Thanks for your time! To disable nags, add the Disable-Nags label.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for your time! To disable nags, add the Disable-Nags label.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.           -reward-unpaid reward-inprocess
          
          <br>

        Hi, thanks for reaching out to request a response to your question. Re: c#36. This issue is in the Intel i915 GFX driver and and was assessed to result in OOB memory access in the GPU process. <span class="line"><!---->Hi, thanks for reaching out to request a response to your question. Re: c#36. This issue is in the Intel i915 GFX driver and and was assessed to result in OOB memory access in the GPU process. <!----></span><br>The reward amount decided upon for this issue is the reward amount for baseline reports for security issues resulting in GPU process memory corruption.<span class="line"><!---->The reward amount decided upon for this issue is the reward amount for baseline reports for security issues resulting in GPU process memory corruption.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        We have reassessed this issue based on that it OOB memory access is indeed in the kernel rather than the GPU process. Based on this we have decided to award you an additional $5,000 + $1,000 bisect bonus. Thanks for your patience for this to be reassessed and allowing us time to make it right!<span class="line"><!---->We have reassessed this issue based on that it OOB memory access is indeed in the kernel rather than the GPU process. Based on this we have decided to award you an additional $5,000 + $1,000 bisect bonus. Thanks for your patience for this to be reassessed and allowing us time to make it right!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          position: relative;

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
